definition: town headman/mayor (of small town or village)/bailiff
to press down/to calm/to subdue/to suppress/to guard/garrison/small town/to cool or chill (food or drinks)

sentences.english: "This is tearing people apart, " said Minnewaukan Mayor Trish McQuoid, fighting back tears.
sentences.chinese: 密尼沃坎鎮長麥闊伊德含淚說，這把人們都逼瘋了。

sentences.english: Teresa has decided to become a candidate for mayor of our town.
sentences.chinese: 特雷薩已決定作爲候選人蔘加本鎮鎮長的競選。

sentences.english: The young leader of the town once invited me to his home for a Tibetan-style feast.
sentences.chinese: 年輕的鎮長請我到他家去喫過一頓臧式大餐。

sentences.english: complained to the mayor, judge Stevens, eighty years old.
sentences.chinese: 鄰家一位婦女向年已八十的法官斯蒂芬斯鎮長抱怨。

sentences.english: Summer lotus and the mayor of Dingyuan sea sea is very dissatisfied with the decision.
sentences.chinese: 夏荷和海鎮長對海定遠的決定非常不滿。

sentences.english: The cockfights, instituted by the mayor himself, were suspended.
sentences.chinese: 鎮長本人鼓勵的鬥雞停止了。

sentences.english: Little imagine, the original idea of the person that say this word is acid alcalde adult oh.
sentences.chinese: 殊不知，說此話者的本意是諷刺鎮長大人的喲。

sentences.english: Two days before my departure, I visited the mayor of the town again to ask him about the process of the house.
sentences.chinese: 離開前的前兩天，我又去問鎮長辦手續的問題。

to make a speech/to make some remarks
